intro: Aldama latibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract aldama, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow flowers surrounded by broad, leaf-like bracts that give it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its botanical structure supports its role as a nectar source for pollinators in its native range.
